item.title: Allow Postfix to Send Mail to Anyone
item.description: in /etc/postfix/main.cf, change: inet_interfaces = localhost to inet_interfaces = all And restart postfix accordingly.

item.title: Cannot Send Email To Own Domain in Postfix
item.description: vi /etc/postfix/main.cf remove the domain ... ... #mydestination = example.com, localhost.com, localhost mydestination = localhost ... ... Then restart postfix: /etc/init.d/postix restart See some further discussion in https://www.digitalocean.com/community/questions/why-won-t-postfix-deliver-mail-to-own-domain

item.title: Check Queue Content in Postfix
item.description: root@example~# postqueue -p Mail queue is empty

item.title: Mail Encryption in Postfix
item.description: in /etc/postfix/main.cf, add: smtpd_tls_security_level = may smtp_tls_security_level = may smtp_tls_loglevel = 1 smtpd_tls_loglevel = 1 Details from From http://blog.snapdragon.cc/2013/07/07/setting-postfix-to-encrypt-all-traffic-when-talking-to-other-mailservers/

item.title: Eliminate Queued Mails in Postfix
item.description: root@example~# postsuper -d ALL postsuper: Deleted: 7966 messages
